00039 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00040 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00041 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00042    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00043    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept them, but uses a dedicated
00044    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00045 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00046 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00047 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00048 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00052 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00053 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00054 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00055 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00057 struct xnthread;

00059 
00060 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00061 
00062     /* Kernel mode side */
00063     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00064     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00065     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00066     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00067     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00068 
00069     /* User mode side */
00070     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00071     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00072 
00073     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00074     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00075     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00076 
00077 } xnarchtcb_t;
00078 
00079 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00080 
00081     unsigned vector;
00082     long errcode;
00083     struct pt_regs *regs;
00084 
00085 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00086 
00087 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((fi)->vector)
00088 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->errcode)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->eip)
00090 /* fault is caused by use FPU while FPU disabled. */
00091 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  ((fi)->vector == 7)
00092 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00093    context. */
00094 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->vector == 14)
00095 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00096                                  ((fi)->vector == 1 || (fi)->vector == 3))
00097 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00103 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00104 
00105 {
00106     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00107         return vmalloc(bytes);
00108 
00109     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00110 }
00111 
00112 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00113 
00114 {
00115     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00116         vfree(chunk);
00117     else
00118         kfree(chunk);
00119 }

00121 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00122 {
00123     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00124 }

00126 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00127 
00128 {
00129     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00130 }

00145 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00146                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))

00151 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00152 
00153 {
00154     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00155 
00156     rthal_load_cpuid();
00157 
00158     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00159        and always inside a critical section. */
00160     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00161     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00162     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00163     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00164     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00165 }
00166 
00167 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00168 {
00169     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00170 }
00171 
00172 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00173                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00174                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00175                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00176                                     )
00177 {
00178 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00179 
00180     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00181         "pushfl\n\t" \
00182         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00183         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00184         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00185         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00186         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00187         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00188         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00189         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00190         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00191         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00192         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00193         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00194         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00195         "ret\n\t" \
00196 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00197         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00198         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00199         "popfl\n\t" \
00200       : /* no output */ \
00201       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00202         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00203         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00204         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00205         "b" (out_tcb), \
00206         "S" (in_tcb), \
00207         "a" (outproc), \
00208         "d" (inproc));
00209 
00210 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00211 
00212     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00213     
00214     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00215         "pushfl\n\t" \
00216         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00217         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00218         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00219         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00220         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00221         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00222         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00223         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00224         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00225         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00226         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00227         "ret\n\t" \
00228 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00229         "popfl\n\t" \
00230       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00231         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00232         "=S" (esi_out), \
00233         "=D" (edi_out), \
00234         "+a" (outproc), \
00235         "+d" (inproc) \
00236       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00237         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00238         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00239         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00240 
00241 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00242 }
00243 
00244 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00245                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00246 {
00247     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00248     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00249     unsigned long fs, gs;
00250 
00251     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00252         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00253            clear the ts bit. */
00254         clts();
00255     
00256     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00257 
00258     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00259         {
00260         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00261 
00262         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00263 
00264         if (!inproc->mm)
00265             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00266         }
00267 
00268     if (out_tcb->user_task) {
00269        /* Make sure that __switch_to() will always reload the correct
00270           %fs and %gs registers, even if we happen to migrate the task
00271           across domains in the meantime. */
00272         asm volatile("mov %%fs,%0":"=m" (fs));
00273         asm volatile("mov %%gs,%0":"=m" (gs));
00274     }
00275 
00276     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00277 
00278     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00279 
00280         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00281 
00282         loadsegment(fs, fs);
00283         loadsegment(gs, gs);
00284 
00285         barrier();
00286 
00287         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00288            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00289            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00290            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00291            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00292            raw I/O ops. */
00293 
00294         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00295             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, rthal_processor_id());
00296 
00297             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00298                 
00299                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00300 
00301                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00302                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00303                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00304                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00305 
00306                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00307                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00308             }
00309         }
00310     }
00311 
00312     stts();
00313 }
00314 
00315 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00316                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00317 {
00318     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00319 }
00320 
00321 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00322 {
00323     /* Empty */
00324 }
00325 
00326 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00327                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00328                                          const char *name)
00329 {
00330     tcb->user_task = current;
00331     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00332     tcb->esp = 0;
00333     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00334     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00335     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00336 }
00337 
00338 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00339                                                int imask,
00340                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00341                                                void *cookie)
00342 {
00343     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00344     stts();
00345     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00346     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00347     entry(cookie);
00348     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00349 }
00350 
00351 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00352                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00353                                        void *cookie,
00354                                        int imask,
00355                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00356                                        char *name)
00357 {
00358     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00359 
00360     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00361     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00362     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00363     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00364     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00365     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00366     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00367     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00368     *--(*psp) = 0;
00369 }
00370 
00371 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00372 
00373 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00374 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   ((task)->used_math)
00375 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) ((task)->used_math = 1)
00376 #else
00377 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   tsk_used_math(task)
00378 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) set_stopped_child_used_math(task)
00379 #endif
00380 
00381 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00382 
00383 {
00384     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00385     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00386        task. */
00387 
00388     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00389 
00390     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00391         {
00392         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00393         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00394         }
00395 
00396     if(task)
00397         {
00398         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: tell Linux that this thread
00399           initialized its FPU hardware. The TS_USEDFPU bit is necessary for
00400           xnarch_save_fpu to save the FPU state at next switch. */
00401         xnarch_set_fpu_init(task);
00402         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00403         }   
00404 }
00405 
00406 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00407 
00408 {
00409     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00410     
00411     if(task)
00412         {
00413         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00414             return;
00415 
00416         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00417            of this task. */
00418         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00419         }
00420 
00421     clts();
00422     
00423     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00424         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00425     else
00426         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00427 }
00428 
00429 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00430 
00431 {
00432     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00433 
00434     if (task)
00435         {
00436         if (!xnarch_fpu_init_p(task))
00437             {
00438             stts();
00439             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00440             }
00441 
00442         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00443            hardware. */
00444         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00445         }
00446 
00447     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00448        user-space or kernel thread. */
00449     clts();
00450 
00451     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00452         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00453     else
00454         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00455 }
00456 
00457 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00458 
00459 {
00460     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00461 
00462     if (task && !(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00463         return;
00464 
00465     clts();
00466 
00467     if (!cpu_has_fxsr && task)
00468         /* fnsave, called by switch_to, initialized the FPU state, so that on
00469            cpus prior to PII (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved
00470            state. */
00471         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00472 }
00473 
00474 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00475 
00476 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00477 
00478 {}
00479 
00480 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00481 
00482 {}
00483 
00484 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00485 
00486 {}
00487 
00488 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00489 
00490 {}
00491 
00492 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00493 
00494 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00495 
00496 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00497 
00498 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00499 {
00500     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00501     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00502     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00503     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00504     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00505     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00506 }
00507 
00508 #define xnarch_alloc_stack(tcb,stacksize) \
00509 ({ \
00510     int __err; \
00511     (tcb)->stacksize = stacksize; \
00512     if (stacksize == 0) { \
00513         (tcb)->stackbase = NULL; \
00514         __err = 0; \
00515     } else { \
00516         (tcb)->stackbase = xnmalloc(stacksize); \
00517         __err = (tcb)->stackbase ? 0 : -ENOMEM; \
00518     } \
00519     __err; \
00520 })
00521 
00522 #define xnarch_free_stack(tcb) \
00523 do { \
00524       if ((tcb)->stackbase) \
00525           xnfree((tcb)->stackbase); \
00526 } while(0)
00527 
00528 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00529 
00530 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00531 
00532 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00533                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00534                                            const char *name)
00535 {
00536     struct task_struct *task = current;
00537 
00538     tcb->user_task = task;
00539     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00540     tcb->esp = 0;
00541     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00542     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00543     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00544 }
00545 
00546 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00547 
00548 {
00549     unsigned irq;
00550 
00551     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00552         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00553                              irq,
00554                              handler,
00555                              NULL,
00556                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00557 }
00558 
00559 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00560 
00561 {
00562     unsigned irq;
00563 
00564     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00565         {
00566         switch (irq)
00567             {
00568 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00569             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00570             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00571             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00572             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00573 
00574                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00575                 continue;
00576 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00577 
00578             default:
00579 
00580                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00581             }
00582         }
00583 }
00584 
00585 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00586 
00587 {
00588     unsigned irq;
00589 
00590     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00591         {
00592         switch (irq)
00593             {
00594 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00595             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00596             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00597             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00598             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00599 
00600                 continue;
00601 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00602 
00603             default:
00604 
00605                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00606             }
00607         }
00608 }
00609 
00610 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00611 
00612 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00613 
00614 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay)
00615 {
00616     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00617        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00618        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00619        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00620     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00621 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_NMI_DEBUG_LATENCY
00622     extern unsigned long rthal_maxlat_tsc;
00623     if (delay <= (ULONG_MAX - rthal_maxlat_tsc))
00624         rthal_nmi_arm(delay + rthal_maxlat_tsc);
00625 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_NMI_DEBUG_LATENCY */
00626 }
00627 
00628 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void)
00629 {
00630     rthal_timer_release();
00631 }
00632 
00633 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00634 {
00635 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00636     return rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00637 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00638     return 0;
00639 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00640 }
00641 
00642 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00643 
00644 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00645 
00646 #include <linux/init.h>
00647 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00648 
00649 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00650 
00651 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00652 
00653 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00654 
00655 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00656 
00657 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00658 
00659 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00660 
00661 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00662 {
00663     struct pt_regs *regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00664     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00665 
00666     fltinfo.vector = event;
00667     fltinfo.errcode = regs->orig_eax;
00668     fltinfo.regs = regs;
00669 
00670     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00671 }
00672 
00673 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00674 
00675 {
00676 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00677     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00678 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00679     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00680        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00681        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00682        configuration Xenomai is compiled against,
00683        CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00684        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00685     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00686 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00687 }
00688 
00689 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00690 
00691 {
00692     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00693 
00694     if (!nktimerlat)
00695         return -ENODEV;
00696 
00697     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00698 
00699     return 0;
00700 }
00701 
00702 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00703 
00704 {
00705     int err;
00706 
00707 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00708     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00709        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00710     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00711 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00712 
00713     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00714 
00715     if (err)
00716         return err;
00717 
00718     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00719 
00720     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00721         return -ENOSYS;
00722 
00723     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00724                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00725                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00726                          NULL,
00727                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00728 
00729     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00730 
00731 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00732     err = xnshadow_mount();
00733 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00734 
00735     if (err)
00736         {
00737         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00738         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00739         }
00740 
00741     return err;
00742 }
00743 
00744 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00745 
00746 {
00747 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00748     xnshadow_cleanup();
00749 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00750     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00751     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00752 }
00753 
00754 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00755 
00756 #ifdef __cplusplus
00757 }
00758 #endif
00759 
00760 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00761 
00762 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00763 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00764 
00765 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
